data.title: Regent University Diversity: Racial Demographics & Other Stats
data.meta_description: Explore Regent University diversity statistics including racial demographics, ethnicity, gender ratio, undergrad enrollment, average ages of students and other Regent student population stats.

Regent Demographics & Diversity Report

Below Average Overall DiversityBelow Average Racial-Ethnic DiversityBelow Average Male/Female Diversity

How diverse is Regent University? College Factual's <nil> diversity report reveals the truth about diversity at Regent. We analyzed racial demographics, gender ratios, student age ranges, and more.

Student PopulationRacial/Ethnic DiversityMale/Female DiversityLocation DiversityStudent Age Diversity

Regent Student Population

10,483 Total Students2,376 Undergraduates1,106 Graduate Students

How Many Students Attend Regent University?

Regent total enrollment is approximately 10,483 students. 2,376 are undergraduates and 1,106 are graduate students.

Regent Undergraduate Population

Male/Female Breakdown of Undergraduates

The full-time Regent undergraduate population is made up of 61% women, and 39% men.

For the gender breakdown for all students, go here.

Regent Racial/Ethnic Breakdown of Undergraduates

See racial/ethnic breakdown for all students.

Regent Graduate Student Population

Male/Female Breakdown of Graduate Students

About 65% of full-time grad students are women, and 35% men.

For the gender breakdown for all students, go here.

Regent Racial-Ethnic Breakdown of Graduate Students

See racial/ethnic breakdown for all students.

Racial/Ethnic Diversity

47% Racial-Ethnic Minorities *High Faculty Racial/Ethnic Diversity

Regent Racial Demographics:

High Racial/Ethnic Diversity Among Faculty

Regent University Faculty Racial/Ethnic Demographics:

Learn more about the faculty at Regent.

Regent Male/Female Diversity

More Female StudentsMore Female Teachers

This school is more popular with women than with men.

There are approximately 6,650 female students and 3,833 male students at Regent.

Close to Even Balance of Male & Female Teachers

Reporting of the gender of Regent is unknown or unavailable.

Faculty Gender Ratio Â 84.90 out of 100.

There are more female teachers than male teachers at this school.

More about Regent faculty.

There are approximately 446 female teachers and 329 male teachers.

High Geographic Diversity

50.29% Out of State1.14% Out of the Country

Regent ranks 322 out of 2,183 when it comes to geographic diversity.

50.29% of Regent students come from out of state, and 1.14% come from out of the country.

Student Location Diversity Â 85 out of 100.

The undergraduate student body is split among 35 states (may include Washington D.C.). Click on the map for more detail.

Top 5 States

International Students at Regent

Students from 37 countries are represented at this school, with the majority of the international students coming from India, Nigeria, and Singapore.

Learn more about international students at Regent.

High Student Age Diversity

High Student Age Diversity11.45% Traditional College Age

The age diversity score this school received indicates it is doing a good job attracting students of all ages.

Student Age Diversity Â 90.90 out of 100.

A traditional college student is defined as being between the ages of 18-21. At Regent, 11.45% of students fall into that category, compared to the national average of 60%.

Notes and References

Footnotes

*The racial-ethnic minorities count is calculated by taking the total number of students and subtracting white students, international students, and students whose race/ethnicity was unknown. This number is then divided by the total number of students at the school to obtain the racial-ethnic minorities percentage.

References
